item.title: SIP Trunking Providers Want Your Bandwidth
item.description:
The telephone industry is undergoing a transformation. Previously, businesses typically relied on in-house PBX systems to manage their phone networks and utilized ISDN PRI trunk lines for external calls. However, this is changing rapidly. Two significant trends are emerging: cloud-based hosted PBX telephone systems and SIP trunking. While these technologies complement each other, it’s possible to implement SIP trunking without cloud services. item.title: Rise Of The Cloud Hosted PBX
item.description:
Traditional, in-house PBX systems might be nearing obsolescence with the emergence of cloud-hosted solutions like AireSpring’s AirePBX. This innovation signifies a return to an older model where the service provider manages the switching system, but with modern technological advancements. This shift back to provider-managed systems, reminiscent of early telephone networks, offers significant cost advantages due to increased competition and the use of existing network infrastructure for VoIP services.
